biogHist.abstract: Margaret Valadian was appointed an Officer of the Order of Australia (AO) on 26 January 1986 and Civil Member of the Order of the British Empire on 12 June 1976 for services to the Aboriginal Community.

chronItem.event: Welfare worker, Welfare Board Northern Territory
Research Officer, Department of Territories Papua New Guinea
Graduated Bachelor Social Studies, University of Queensland (first Aboriginal graduate of this university)
Department of Native Affairs, Western Australia
Completed Master of Education, University of Hawaii
Completed Master of Social Welfare, State University of New York
Social Planning consultant, Schools Commission Canberra
Director, Queensland Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Teacher Aides Development Program
Director, Aboriginal Education Centre, University of Wollongong
Founder and co-director, Aboriginal Training and Cultural Institute (Sydney)
Visiting Professor, Rural Education at the University of Alaska
Deputy Chair, New South Wales Board of Adult Education
Awarded the honourary degree of Doctor of Letters from Macquarie University
Winner: Alumnus of the Year Award, The University of Queensland's Alumni Association
Member, Council of the Order of Australia

descriptiveNote.p: Co-founded the Aboriginal Training and Cultural Institute in Sydney
